pkmkdoc.description: Plone is a powerful and flexible open-source content management system powered by Zope and Python. http://plone.org

choice.title: Plone
choice.description: Installs Plone. Options include standalone versus cluster, server-mode, and startup item.

choice.title: Python, Zope, Plone Base
choice.description: Installs Python, Paster, ZopeSkel, Zope and the components of Plone.

choice.title: Stand-Alone Instance
choice.description: Choose this option to install a stand-alone Zope instance. This is a good testing and development installation method.

choice.title: ZEO Cluster
choice.description: Choose this option to install Zope in a client-server, Zope Enterprise Objects configuration. This is usually better for a production server install.

choice.title: Production Mode Install
choice.description: This uses administrative privileges to install Zope and Plone in a configuration that's more appropriate for a production server. If you choose this option, you'll need to use the "sudo" command and an administrator's password to start Zope/Plone. This is more secure, but makes development and testing harder.

choice.title: Install Startup Item
choice.description: Choose this option to install set up a startup item that will automatically start Plone when your Mac starts or restarts. This is only available for production-mode installations.
